result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander R Jefferson-Cooper

defendant.name: Jefferson-Cooper, Alexander R

records.addlTxt: and returned.

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 2300 block of Post Rd in Fitchburg. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 8:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with LC or MS. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Copy of minutes from STC Hrg on 6/3/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.
**DA'S OFFICE WILL NEED TO WRIT DE TO COURT** FOR ALL HEARINGS
Jury trial on December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury selection on December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on November 29, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Referral to DCPS for GPS monitoring

Court reporter Teri Groves. Attorney Peter R. Moyers in court on behalf of defendant.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In court today for a status conference regarding a speedy trial demand filed by the DE. Atty Moyer answers questions of the court. Court will reduce the cash bail to a signature bond and order a referral to pretrial services for GPS. All previously ordered bond conditions remain the same. The speedy trial demand is rendered moot due to signature bond being issued for the DE. Case is set for trial. FPT 11-29-22 at 3:15pm. JS 12-12-2022. JT 12-14/15-2022.

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
 Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Peter R. Moyers.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State finds Counts 1,3,5 transactionally related;  Law Enforcement duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - waives argument; Ct binds case over;   Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
